condition.description:
A fever is a body temperature that is higher than normal. It is not an illness. It is part of your body's defense against infection. Most bacteria and viruses that cause infections do well at the body's normal temperature (98.6 F). A slight fever can make it harder for them to survive. Fever also activates your body's immune system.

Infections cause most fevers. There can be many other causes, including

  • Medicines
  • Heat exhaustion
  • Cancers
  • Autoimmune diseases

Treatment depends on the cause of your fever. Your health care provider may recommend using over-the-counter medicines such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen to lower a very high fever. Adults can also take aspirin, but children with fevers should not take aspirin. It is also important to drink enough liquids to prevent dehydration.
condition.name: Fever

carousel_items: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough starts working in about 30 minutes.
Chlorpheniramine (the antihistamine in Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough) can make you sleepy, so avoid activities that require you to be fully alert until you know how it affects you.
Phenylephrine (the decongestant ingredient) can make you restless, so don't take it too close to bedtime.
Let your doctor know if your symptoms don't improve in a few days, or if you have a really bad sore throat with a fever, headache, nausea, or vomiting.
Don't take Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough if you're pregnant.

basics.benefits_moa: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough is a combination medicine that treats cold and flu symptoms. Aspirin relieves pain and reduces fever. Chlorpheniramine is an antihistamine that treats runny nose and watery eyes. Dextromethorphan is a cough suppressant. Phenylephrine is a decongestant that clears your sinuses.
basics.bottom_line: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough is good for multiple cold symptoms, but it's more medicine than you need if you only have one symptom.
downsides: If you don't really need all of the medications in this combination, you're taking extra medicine and might have extra side effects for no reason.
Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other decongestants like pseudoephedrine.
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.
The aspirin in Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough interacts with many other drugs and health conditions.

downsides_processed.orig: If you don't really need all of the medications in this combination, you're taking extra medicine and might have extra side effects for no reason.
Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other decongestants like pseudoephedrine.
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.
The aspirin in Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough interacts with many other drugs and health conditions.

upsides: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold symptoms. It's good to use if you have a stuffy nose, a cough, fever, and pain.

Phenylephrine (the decongestant ingredient) has fewer side effects than other decongestants like pseudoephedrine. It doesn't raise your blood pressure and heart rate as much, or cause as much trouble falling asleep.
Dextromethorphan (the cough suppressant ingredient) works well and has very few side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough contains aspirin, which can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Taking aspirin, NSAIDs, or blood thinners
Drinking more than 3 alcoholic beverages a day

description_processed.orig: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough contains aspirin, which can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Chlorpheniramine, the antihistamine in Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough, lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking with other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Chlorpheniramine, the antihistamine in Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough, lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough can harm unborn babies. Aspirin can increase the risk of a heart defect in an unborn baby if you take it during the last 3 months of pregnancy (last trimester). Phenylephrine can also be unsafe to take during the first 3 months of pregnancy (first trimester). Instead, it's safer to use a decongestant nasal spray for up to 3 days. Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Reye's syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough contains aspirin, which has been linked to a rare but serious illness called Reye syndrome. Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough shouldn’t be used in children and teenagers. If you notice changes in your child’s behavior or nausea and vomiting (early signs of Reye’s syndrome), call your doctor and get medical care right away.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: People taking Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

description_processed.orig: People taking Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition when there's too much serotonin in the brain. The dextromethorphan in Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough, when used with other medicines that affect serotonin (antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort), increases your risk for serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have these symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

basics.bottom_line: Alka-Seltzer Plus Day Cold and Flu is good for multiple cold symptoms, but it's more medicine than you need if you only have one symptom.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer Plus Day Cold and Flu contains acetaminophen, also known as Tylenol or APAP, and is a common ingredient in many other over-the-counter medicines. Taking too much acetaminophen causes liver damage that can be permanent and life-threatening. In case of an overdose, call your local Poison Control Center and get medical attention immediately.
risk_factors: Drinking more than 2 alcoholic beverages a day

risks_warnings.title: Chronic cough from an infection
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know if you have lung problems like chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) or a chronic cough before taking Alka-Seltzer Plus Day Cold and Flu. Make sure to tell your doctor if your cough doesn't go away after a week or comes back after getting better, especially if you're coughing up significantly more mucus (phlegm), which can be a sign of a more serious infection.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: People taking Alka-Seltzer Plus Night Cold and Flu and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Chronic cough from an infection
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know if you have lung problems like chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) or a chronic cough before taking Alka-Seltzer Plus Night Cold and Flu. description_processed.orig: Ibuprofen is an NSAID that can lower kidney function or cause damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time lowers your risk. Your doctor should check your kidney function if you take Ibuprofen for any amount of time.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Ibuprofen can increase the risk of a heart defect in an unborn baby if you take it during the last 3 months of pregnancy (last trimester). Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

Phenylephrine, the decongestant, can make you restless, so don't take it too close to bedtime.

basics.benefits_moa: Robitussin Daytime Cold Plus Flu is a combination medicine that treats cold and flu symptoms. Acetaminophen relieves pain and reduces fever. Dextromethorphan is a cough suppressant. Phenylephrine is a decongestant that clears your sinuses.
basics.bottom_line: Robitussin Daytime Cold Plus Flu is good for multiple cold and flu symptoms, but it's more medicine than you need if you only have one symptom.
downsides: If you don't really need all of the medications in this combination, you're taking extra medicine and might have extra side effects for no reason.
Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other oral decongestants like pseudoephedrine.
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.
To avoid hurting your liver, you have to keep track of the total amount of acetaminophen (APAP) you're taking since it's a very common ingredient in pain and cold/flu combination medicines.

downsides_processed.orig: If you don't really need all of the medications in this combination, you're taking extra medicine and might have extra side effects for no reason.
Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other oral decongestants like pseudoephedrine.
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.
To avoid hurting your liver, you have to keep track of the total amount of acetaminophen (APAP) you're taking since it's a very common ingredient in pain and cold/flu combination medicines.

upsides: Robitussin Daytime Cold Plus Flu is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold and flu symptoms. It's good to use if you have a stuffy nose, a cough, fever, and pain.

The decongestant (phenylephrine) has fewer side effects than other decongestants like pseudoephedrine. It doesn't raise your blood pressure and heart rate as much, or cause as much trouble falling asleep.
The pain reliever (acetaminophen) is easier on your stomach and has fewer drug interactions than other pain medications like aspirin or ibuprofen.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Robitussin Nighttime Multi-Symptom Cold CF contains acetaminophen, also known as Tylenol or APAP, and is a common ingredient in many other over-the-counter medicines. Taking too much acetaminophen causes liver damage that can be permanent and life-threatening. In case of an overdose, call your local Poison Control Center and get medical attention immediately.
risk_factors: Drinking more than 3 alcoholic beverages a day

description_processed.orig: Robitussin Nighttime Multi-Symptom Cold CF contains acetaminophen, also known as Tylenol or APAP, and is a common ingredient in many other over-the-counter medicines. Taking too much acetaminophen causes liver damage that can be permanent and life-threatening. In case of an overdose, call your local Poison Control Center and get medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Robitussin Nighttime Multi-Symptom Cold CF can raise your blood pressure. If you already have high blood pressure and are taking medicine to control it, or have taken MAO inhibitors (a group of drugs used to treat depression and Parkinson's disease) in the last 14 days, you should consider using a different medication.

description_processed.orig: Robitussin Nighttime Multi-Symptom Cold CF can raise your blood pressure. risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Diphenhydramine, the antihistamine ingredient, lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking with other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Diphenhydramine, the antihistamine ingredient, lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Increased falls
risks_warnings.description: Diphenhydramine, an antihistamine also known as Benadryl, can make you feel dizzy or drowsy. People who are at a higher risk of falls should avoid using Robitussin Nighttime Multi-Symptom Cold CF.
risk_factors: Taking other drugs that make you drowsy or dizzy

description_processed.orig: Diphenhydramine, an antihistamine also known as Benadryl, can make you feel dizzy or drowsy. People who are at a higher risk of falls should avoid using Robitussin Nighttime Multi-Symptom Cold CF.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: Robitussin Nighttime Multi-Symptom Cold CF can harm unborn babies. Phenylephrine can be unsafe to take during the first 3 months of pregnancy (first trimester). Instead, it's safer to use a decongestant nasal spray for up to 3 days. Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: People taking Sudafed PE Pressure Pain and Cough and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

description_processed.orig: People taking Sudafed PE Pressure Pain and Cough and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Chronic cough from an infection
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know if you have lung problems like chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) or a chronic cough before taking Sudafed PE Pressure Pain and Cough.  Make sure you tell your doctor if your cough doesn't go away after a week or comes back after getting better, especially if you're coughing up significantly more mucus (phlegm), which can be a signs of a more serious infection.
risk_factors: History of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)

description_processed.orig: Let your doctor know if you have lung problems like chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) or a chronic cough before taking Sudafed PE Pressure Pain and Cough.  Make sure you tell your doctor if your cough doesn't go away after a week or comes back after getting better, especially if you're coughing up significantly more mucus (phlegm), which can be a signs of a more serious infection.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition when there's too much serotonin in the brain. The dextromethorphan in Sudafed PE Pressure Pain and Cough, when used with other medicines that affect serotonin (antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort), increases your risk for serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have these symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

basics.benefits_moa: Theraflu Nighttime Severe Cold and Cough is a combination medicine that treats cold and flu symptoms. Acetaminophen relieves pain and reduces fever. Phenylephrine is a decongestant that clears your sinuses. Diphenhydramine is an antihistamine that treats runny nose and watery eyes and helps you sleep.
basics.bottom_line: Theraflu Nighttime Severe Cold and Cough is good for treating multiple cold and flu symptoms, but it won't relieve coughing.
downsides: Theraflu Nighttime Severe Cold and Cough doesn't stop coughing, but drinking warm water will help sooth your throat.
The antihistamine (diphenhydramine) can make you feel groggy the next morning.
Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other decongestants like pseudoephedrine.
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.
To avoid hurting your liver, you have to keep track of the total amount of acetaminophen (APAP) you're taking since it's a very common ingredient in pain and cold/flu combination medicines.

downsides: Indomethacin can cause serious heart and stomach problems. The risk goes up the longer you take it, but problems can happen at any time. Don't take Indomethacin any longer than your doctor recommends.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. The risk can increase the longer you take it. Talk to your doctor about taking the lowest dose that works for you for the shortest time possible.

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. The risk can increase the longer you take it. Talk to your doctor about taking the lowest dose that works for you for the shortest time possible.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin can cause serious stomach problems, such as ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. These problems can be life-threatening and can cause death. The risk can increase the longer you take it, but it can happen at any time. Watch out for blood or dark-colored stools. This can be a medical emergency and you should get help right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin can cause serious stomach problems, such as ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. This can be a medical emergency and you should get help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin may cause birth defects. Don't use Indomethacin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin may cause birth defects. Don't use Indomethacin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Indomethacin can cause serious allergic reactions.  These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. If you have Asthma, don't take Indomethacin if you're experiencing a runny nose (Rhinitis) with or without nasal polyps.  Also, don't take Indomethacin if you've experienced an asthma attack after taking aspirin or other NSAID type medications.  Stop taking Indomethacin and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor right away.

Also, don't take Indomethacin if you've experienced an asthma attack after taking aspirin or other NSAID type medications.  Stop taking Indomethacin and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening kidney or liver function
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose. (No dose adjustments are specified on the manufacturer's label.)

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose. (No dose adjustments are specified on the manufacturer's label.)

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems due to high potassium
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Indomethacin.

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Indomethacin.

risks_warnings.title: Bleeding or bruising
risks_warnings.description: You can bleed or bruise more easily while taking Indomethacin. Tell your doctor about any medicines you are taking or any health conditions before starting Indomethacin. If you take blood-thinning medicines, don't take Indomethacin without talking to your doctor first.

carousel_items: If taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth, take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can cause stomach ulcers, especially if taking it by mouth often.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily. You shouldn't take any other 'blood thinner' medications unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Don't use it the first two weeks after a heart surgery.
Can affect your kidneys' ability to work as well.

If using the skin (topical) gel, use the dosing card it comes with to make sure you measure the correct dose. You also won't have many of the same side effects that you would if taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth.

basics.benefits_moa: Diclofenac sodium is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Diclofenac sodium works well for pain and causes less upset stomach than other NSAIDs.
downsides: Can cause serious stomach problems like inflammation, ulcers, and bleeding. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time while taking it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.
Can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. These problems are more likely the longer you take it.

Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.
Can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. These problems are more likely the longer you take it.

upsides: Works well to relieve pain and inflammation from osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis.
Good for muscle aches and pains.
May treat arthritis pain better than other similar medicines (NSAIDs).
Can cause less upset stomach than other NSAIDs like ibuprofen (Advil).
It's also available as a gel that you put on your skin. If it's hard for you to swallow pills, this could be a good option.
If you're only using the gel, you won't have the same side effects that you would while taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth.

userStories.tip: Took Diclofenac SOD for CPPD (Inflammatory arthritis) for yrs before bilateral knee replacements. 3yrs later, I'm having swelling/pain after golf/long walks/workouts.  Meloxicam didn't help so asked for Diclofenac.  It still works for me!

userStories.identifier: Male with occasionally severe back pain
userStories.tip: My doctor prescribed Voltaren because he has completely undue fears of VicoProfen, but while VicoProfen works exceptionally well, Voltaren has no detectable effect on my pain.
If you feel dizzy, bring it up to your doctor.  Mine lowered the dosage and it helped a lot!

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Diclofenac sodium can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Take the lowest dose for the shortest time possible to lower your risk. Never take Diclofenac sodium during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

description_processed.orig: Diclofenac sodium can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Take the lowest dose for the shortest time possible to lower your risk. Never take Diclofenac sodium during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Diclofenac sodium can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers

description_processed.orig: Diclofenac sodium can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time.

risks_warnings.title: Bruising or bleeding
risks_warnings.description: You can bruise more easily while using Diclofenac sodium. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. Tell your doctor about all of your medical conditions and medications before starting Diclofenac sodium. Don't take Diclofenac sodium while using other blood thinning medications unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

description_processed.orig: You can bruise more easily while using Diclofenac sodium. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. Tell your doctor about all of your medical conditions and medications before starting Diclofenac sodium. risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Diclofenac sodium can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life-threatening. Stop taking Diclofenac sodium and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Lowers kidney function
risks_warnings.description: Diclofenac sodium, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk of kidney problems. It's important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Diclofenac sodium for long periods of time.
risk_factors: Taking ACE inhibitors or angiotensin receptor blockers (ARBs)

risks_warnings.title: Increased blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Diclofenac sodium can raise your blood pressure.  Most people usually don't feel any differently when their blood pressure is high, so check your blood pressure periodically to watch out for it. If you have high blood pressure and need a medication for the long-term treatment of pain, talk with your doctor since a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: If you're in the late stages of pregnancy (more than 30 weeks), taking Diclofenac sodium can increase the risk of a heart defect in your baby. Talk with your doctor before using this medication while pregnant.
